::DarkMouse::

She saw the fight again on the Pred ship.  She ran to the entrance 
and ran outside the ship.  She saw the land was nothing but waste 
land now.  It wasn't green and lush and full of life. It was as if 
the land had died.  She walked off the entrance ramp and down to the 
ground.  Her feet touched dry dirt and dust rose as she walked.
She sniffed the air, it was hot, dry, and smelled of death and rust.
She turned and saw the Pred ship in ruin.  It had been blown apart 
and had huge gaping holes all though out the structure.  She looked 
through one hole and saw the ground on the other side. A slight 
breeze picked up and the dust blew around the dry, dead ground.

She walked for what seamed like forever. She came to a forest.  No 
animals were there, no noise of birds. The trees were burnt and 
fallen.  She walked through and saw only death and decay.  She saw 
bones of animals on the ground, from birds, deer, bears,small 
rodents, all dead and had been dead for a long time.  She stopped at 
what looked like an old stream bed.  It was dry and the ground was 
cracked.  She sobbed, "What happened?"  She saw the bones of fish 
laying in the swirling dust.

She turned her back to the stream, and she was suddenly looking at 
another ship,the Ark.  She saw a hugh hole infront of the decreped, 
rusting form of what had once been the maximal ship.  She walked 
around the ship, everything was charred and rotting away.  The ship 
looked like it had been in a nuclear holocost.  The trees around the 
ship here leveled or burned away.  She walked around to the backside 
of the ship.  She stopped.  Her face was wrentched in terror.  She 
screamed,"NOOOOOOOOO!"

In the lab, she screamed and it echoed around the lab walls.

She saw before her eyes, the decaying forms of her comrads.  She saw 
Megatron and KitKat, Terrorsaur,Quickstrike,Phobia,Black Aracnia, 
Paralysis, all laying on the ground,Dead.  She started sobbing. She 
walked around the corpses looking at them.  Thier faces locked in 
terror and pain.  She looked around and then saw the maximal bodies 
laying near her comrads.  All had pained looks of agony and fear.
She knelt down on the ground and next to Quickstrike."What happened 
here?" She looked at Quickstrike and took his skeletal hand in hers.
"Forgive me, I was not here to help you. I wasn't able to die with 
you commander. I let you down my friend. I tried to fight bravely on 
the pred ship.  Tried to save it from the Maximals. But they must 
have lived seeing all was destroyed." She looked down and sighed 
heavy heartedly. "I did what I could to serve you. But I failed you. 
I failed you my friend. I failed you my commander. Forgive me."

In the lab, she was mumbling "Forgive me."

She put his hand down gently on the ground. She cried for him.  She 
got up and walked over to Megatron. She looked at her former leader's 
face.  She saw pain in his face as well.  She knelt down next to 
him, "I'm sorry Commander.  I had to stay with Quickstrike.  He was 
the one I was programmed to follow. He was also my friend.  I 
couldn't abandon my friend. I'm sorry Commander. Forgive me."
She got up and walked over to Paralysis and Black Aracnia.
"I tried to save the ship Black Aracnia, your ship. But I failed you."

In the lab, she muttered the words,"I failed you."

"Please understand, I did the best I could to save you and the ship 
Black Aracnia.  I did try my best, but it wasn't good enough." She 
looked at Paralysis. "I'm sorry let you down as well. Please forgive 
me."

She turned and walked away from the bodies laying in the gathering 
dust.  She walked towards the ship.  But now the ship was gone.  She 
turned and the bodies were gone.  It was all gone.  She was standing 
in an open space of whirling dust and sand and ash. Everything was 
gone. All she saw was dried ground and dust swirling in the breeze.  
Not an animal, not a bot, not a ship, nothing was there. Bare ground 
and dirt.  She stood there sobbing, feeling alone, helpless,fearfull 
of what had happened, and remose for letting her friends down and not 
dieing with them.  She knelt down on her knees and cried. Only the 
wind heard her cry.

In the lab, she lay still, not making a sound, not moving. But a 
single tear rolled down her face.
